name: London-Laurel County Rescue Squad
description: Professional emergency rescue service providing life-saving rescue services to the citizens and visitors of Laurel County, Kentucky. Services include auto accident response, search and rescue operations (including canine operations), drowning/near drowning incidents, high/low angle rope operations, water rescue/recovery (surface and subsurface), swift water rescue, trench rescue, building collapse, farm-related rescues, confined space incidents, off-road incidents, animal rescue, and acts of terrorism. Highly trained team responds throughout Laurel County and across Kentucky.
source: Verified from official website and contact information
hours_of_operation: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week (emergency response)
notes: Chief: John Allen. PIO: LT. Chanel Reams. The organization has over 30,000 followers on Facebook and maintains active training programs. They conduct regular rescue drills and offer training opportunities for other emergency response agencies in Laurel County. The squad is highly skilled and responds to emergencies across Kentucky, not just locally.
